page.title: 01INTRODUCTION - SOUTH SHIRLEY
page.content: The south Shirley area is a classic urban fringe-where town meets country.It is fairly level,130 to 150 m.in height.In the eighties it is changing fast.The countryside is being devoured by the relentless spread of housing,industry and communications.On the following pages much can be seen about the "old days",when the area was a farming area. Shirley is closely tied to communications-the Stratford Canal,Birmingham-Stratford railway line and the main A34 Birmingham-Stratford trunk road all cross the area from north to south. Today the people of Shirley are generally affluent-most live in good homes,are in employment(especially tertiary)and they enjoy varied leisure facilities with frequent holidays.
